p.b: This code system defines the following properties for its concepts

div.p:
This code system
http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/sex-for-clinical-use defines the following codes:

tr.td: Available data indicates that diagnostics, analytics, and treatments should consider best practices associated with female reference populations.
Available data indicates that diagnostics, analytics, and treatments should consider best practices associated with male reference populations.

Available data indicates that diagnostics, analytics, and treatment best practices may be undefined or not aligned with sex-derived reference populations. Additional information (usually, but not always, in the form of comments and/or observations) is available, but does not align with male sex for clinical use or female sex for clinical use.

description.value: Codes that represent a sex characterization that can be associated with a specific clinical context

definition.value: Available data indicates that diagnostics, analytics, and treatments should consider best practices associated with female reference populations.
Available data indicates that diagnostics, analytics, and treatments should consider best practices associated with male reference populations.

Available data indicates that diagnostics, analytics, and treatment best practices may be undefined or not aligned with sex-derived reference populations. Additional information (usually, but not always, in the form of comments and/or observations) is available, but does not align with male sex for clinical use or female sex for clinical use.

valueString.value: Individuals or systems providing care should either use default behavior that is safe for both male and female populations, individually review treatment options with the patient, or carefully inspect comments and relevant observations before proceeding with treatment. Systems that are unable to review additional information that may be associated with an SFCU value may manage a SPECIFIED and an UNKNOWN value in the same way.
Systems that are unable to review additional information that may be associated with an SFCU value may manage a SPECIFIED and an UNKNOWN value in the same way.
